Opening Credits / Title Sequence
Bronn and Jaime contemplate the army before them
Jon asks Tyrion why people would want to live in a city
Comparison: In the books, there are 500,000 residents in King's Landing, not one million.

Scene: Cersei instructs the Mountain on the killing order
Bronn and co escorts Tyrion and co
Words are exchanged on opposing sides
Comparison: There is no mention in the books that the ironborn kill defective babies at birth, as an act of mercy. It is done at the pirate dens of the Three Sisters.

Scene: The wight is brought out and Euron leaves
Jon is admonished and Tyrion decides to talk to Cersei
Jaime and Tyrion share a few words
Comparison: Cersei tried to get Tyrion killed only once - by the court trial. In the books, it has not been confirmed that she sent Ser Mandon Moore to kill him.

Scene: Tyrion tries to convince Cersei
Comparison:
In the books, Cersei believes incorrectly that Tyrion is guilty of Myrcella's near-fatal injury, but her suspicion has nothing to do with Tywin's murder. She thinks Tyrion hired Ser Gerold "Darkstar" Dayne, who attempted to murder Myrcella (she survived but was permanently disfigured).

Cersei still believes Tyrion is guilty of Joffrey's death, thinking he and the Tyrells conspired together to kill him.

Scene: Daenerys and Jon talk about dragons past
Cersei joins the fight
Petyr talks Sansa into assuming the worst of her siblings
Daenerys hears advice on how to go North
Theon confides his regrets to Jon
Comparison:
In the books, Theon never thought Eddard Stark was more of a father to him than Balon. He said once that Eddard was a second father to him, but it was only a lip service: to him, Eddard had always remained the man who'd brought blood and fire to the Pyke and taken him from his home.

Asha never attempted to rescue Theon. Currently they are held captive at Stannis's camp.

Scene: Theon convinces the Iron men to rescue Yara
Comparison: In the books, Theon's physical condition is so poor, as a result of Ramsay's torturing, that he cannot put up any fight against stronger opponents, whether he was castrated or not.

Scene: Sansa lays charges against Petyr
Comparison:
Sansa knows firsthand that Littlefinger made Lysa murder her husband, and also made her send Catelyn the letter in which she falsely accused the Lannisters; Lysa blurted that out in Sansa's presence, shortly after she tried to push Sansa through the Moon Door.

Littlefinger never denied the dagger originally belonged to him; similarly to the show, he said that outright to Catelyn and Ned in the first book. His lie was about the identity of the person to whom he lost the knife in a bet, which was not Tyrion but Robert. Moreover, Littlefinger had nothing to do with the failed attempt on Bran's life - it was Joffrey who armed and sent the catspaw assassin.

Scene: Cersei reveals the true plan to Jaime
Comparison:
The Golden Company consists of 10,000 soldiers, not 20,000.
The break up between Jaime and Cersei happens much earlier in the books; After they have sex for the last time beside Joffrey's body, they grow to loathe each other very deeply; Jaime even contemplates killing Cersei. Finally, when Cersei writes to Jaime to come to her aid, he turns away from her because he no longer loves her, and has found out she sleeps with other men and is guilty of all the crimes she is charged with (high treason, incest, adultery, fornication, regicide, and deicide).

Scene: Jaime rides off into the snow
Sam and Bran find out the truth about Jon
Jon enters Daenerys' room
Jon's true name is revealed
Arya and Sansa reflect
Bran's warging shows the attack on Eastwatch
